title: Welcome to my website
welcome_description: We provide industrial machinery repair and maintenance services, along with high-quality mechanical tools such as drill bits, taps, and milling cutters to help businesses increase production efficiency and reduce costs.
carousel_description: With a team of experienced technicians, we are committed to providing fast and accurate maintenance and repair services. All mechanical tool products meet strict technical standards, fulfilling all production requirements.
growth_description: From basic equipment to specialized tools, we provide solutions to optimize your machining processes. Let us accompany you on every step of your development journey and help enhance sustainable production efficiency.
company_intro: KYOWA MACHINERY CO., LTD, headquartered in Japan, is an affiliate of the KYOWA Group in Vietnam.
company_address: Address: 3-216 Hira, Nishi-ku, Aichi Prefecture, Nagoya City, Japan
company_representative: Legal representative: Mr. Kazunori Yanase – Position: Chief Executive Officer (CEO)
company_clients: Currently, we have over 50 clients, including major corporations in Vietnam and abroad, as well as FDI enterprises such as Viettel Group, Kyocera, Nidec Corp., Panasonic, Samsung, Molex, and more.
product_intro: Kyowa Group currently supplies Takumi’s Screw and Barrel products.
product_quality: The products have been inspected and quality-assessed by Kyowa at factories in both Vietnam and Japan.
product_commitment: Kyowa is committed to ensuring product quality with a long-term warranty policy and a team of technicians ready to provide support to ensure uninterrupted production.
service_commitment: KYOWA Group is committed to delivering maximum customer satisfaction with high-quality products, the best support services, guaranteed schedules, and optimal efficiency at the most reasonable cost.
about_description: KYOWA Group operates in the industrial and supporting industries, specifically:
about_bullet_1: Technical services including (repair, replacement, maintenance, servicing of machinery, equipment, molds, jigs) for the mold industry, plastic injection, and automation.
about_bullet_2: Trading and import-export: machinery, equipment, spare parts, consumables (oil, grease, chemicals, auxiliary materials...) for production, assembly, and packaging.
about_bullet_3: Consulting and providing automation and optimization solutions in production.
about_bullet_4: Co-manufacturing with partners on products such as: molds, precision plastic components, jigs, precision mechanical parts, and automation systems.
tools_description: We offer a full range of drill bits, taps, milling cutters, and more — suitable for various materials and machining needs.
tools_bullet_3: Compatible with CNC and handheld drills
repair_description: We provide industrial machinery repair and maintenance with a highly skilled technical team, offering on-site support upon request.
consult_description: We offer consultation for selecting suitable tools and designing machining processes to optimize production efficiency and cost.
support_description: We are always ready to support you before, during, and after your purchase to ensure the most effective use of our products and services.
service_maintenance_description: We offer maintenance and repair services for industrial machinery and specialized mechanical equipment, handled by experienced technicians.
service_tools_description: We distribute drill bits, taps, milling cutters, grinding wheels, measuring tools, and a full range of precision machining tools.
service_consulting_description: We advise on tool selection and machining processes tailored to each material, helping optimize cost and improve productivity.
service_custom_description: We offer custom design and machining of mechanical parts and machine components based on drawings or samples, ensuring precision and technical quality.
service_delivery_description: Fast nationwide delivery with careful packaging and flexible return support if the product does not match the description.
service_support_description: Our technical team is ready to assist with product usage, troubleshooting, and provide post-sale support for our customers.
testimonial_1_role: Owner of a mechanical workshop in Binh Duong
testimonial_1_text: I used the CNC machine repair service here – very professional, skilled technicians, and quick turnaround. My workshop was back in operation in just one day.
testimonial_2_text: The company supplies high-quality cutting tools – imported end mills and drill bits that are durable. Fast delivery and clear quotations.
testimonial_3_text: Ordering measuring tools and taps online is very convenient, good price, and great technical support. I will continue to support them long-term.
testimonial_4_text: I highly appreciate the technical team – they handled machine issues quickly, especially with older manual lathes. Dedicated and reliable service.
testimonial_5_text: I’ve been buying mechanical tools wholesale here for over 2 years. The products are consistent and genuine, and the consulting team understands the industry well, making cooperation easy.
cta_heading: Contact us now for a consultation!
cta_description: Having issues with mechanical machinery? Need reliable, affordable cutting tools? Don’t let machine downtime interrupt your production. We’re ready to provide technical support, consulting, and the right equipment for your needs.
product_5_title: KPS8000 Compressed & Refined Anti-Corrosive Powder Steel Series
faq_q1: Does your company provide custom design and manufacturing services?
faq_a1: Yes. We specialize in precision mechanical design and machining based on customer drawings, specifications, or samples. Guaranteed quality and on-time delivery.
faq_q2: Are your products covered by warranty?
faq_a2: All products and equipment manufactured or installed by us are covered by a 6–12 month warranty depending on the item. 24/7 technical support is available during usage.
faq_q3: Do you provide repair and maintenance for industrial machinery?
faq_a3: Yes. We offer repair and maintenance services for industrial machinery, drive systems, pneumatic-hydraulic systems, and production lines—either at the customer site or our workshop.
faq_q4: How long does it take to complete a typical order?
faq_a4: It depends on complexity and quantity. For standard mechanical parts, the average completion time is 3–7 days. For custom orders, it may take 10–15 days.
faq_q5: Do you offer on-site technical consulting and inspection?
faq_a5: Yes. Our technicians can visit your factory to assess, measure, and recommend the most suitable solutions tailored to your production needs.

service.solutionDesc2: Our services have supported many large factories in industries such as food production, mechanical engineering, textiles, plastics, and printing – helping reduce risks and increase productivity significantly.

use_daido_material: Using Daido Steel's corrosion and wear-resistant materials to achieve high durability
create_nozzle: Creating nozzles that prevent stringing and dripping
durability_issue: Are you experiencing durability or dripping issues? We have been able to solve your problems with Watanabe Manufacturing's unique know-how.
solution: We can solve these problems with high durability and low cost.
condition_same: *All conditions are the same except nozzle temperature
same_condition: Same molding conditions, and anti-stringing and dripping nozzles were used.
adjust_temperature: By adjusting the nozzle temperature, stringing was prevented.
nozzle_function: The ultimate function of the nozzle is to deliver resin to the mold smoothly and create good contact between the nozzle and mold. Nozzle performance must ensure no resin leakage during injection. Wear at the nozzle tip and wear at the nozzle orifice can cause many negative effects.
nozzle_accumulation: If resin accumulates on the inner diameter of the nozzle, it will escape as burnt impurities. Furthermore, the nozzle is the injection part with the largest temperature fluctuation, so if the temperature at the nozzle tip decreases, it can cause cold slugging, and if the temperature increases, it can cause resin stringing.
nozzle_material_design: First, by using nozzle materials with good heat retention and designing to prevent resin stringing and dripping, you can ensure smoother molding operation.
wear_intro: ○There are many causes of wear in screws, cylinders, etc.
wear_types: Can be classified into three main types: abrasive wear, corrosive wear, and adhesive wear.
wear_factors_intro: ○The following factors are considered causes of wear.
wear_factor_1: Screw material and structure not suitable for molding resin.
wear_factor_2: Factors related to plastic raw materials (additives, reinforcing materials, colorants, etc.).
wear_factor_3: Molding process not performed under optimal conditions.
wear_factor_4: Drive systems like screw shaft and cylinder not properly aligned.
corrosive_wear: Corrosive wear is chemical attack on the outer circumference of the screw and inner surface of the cylinder by corrosive chemical components generated during heating and melting of plastics. Fluorine-based resins are generally considered the source of corrosive chemical components, but they can also appear in many mixed resins and aromatic resins called super engineering plastics. This phenomenon often leads to pitted metal surfaces, and the reason the screw tip is prone to wear is because it is the part that reaches the highest temperature during molding. The most effective countermeasure against corrosive wear is to replace the screw, cylinder and other parts with steel materials with excellent corrosion resistance.
adhesive_wear: Adhesive wear occurs when the screw and cylinder surfaces come into metal contact due to resin adhesion, etc. If molding conditions are not suitable for the molding resin, local friction occurs due to screw rotation, causing the outer circumference of the screw check ring to contact the inner surface of the cylinder, causing the hard layer to peel off. To avoid this, we believe it is necessary to change the screw and cylinder material combination, as well as change the screw design relative to the molding resin. Also, note that center alignment during assembly of parts has a significant impact.

mixing_casting: High mixing and molding capability through screw design
mixing_issue_text: Handling mixing problems during molding is not difficult, but if the mixing method is incorrect, it can lead to burning, contamination, and product damage. Watanabe Seisakusho has solved many molding mixing problems by changing screw design.
mixing_issue_intro: We often hear about molding problems due to insufficient mixing. It is known that insufficient mixing can be solved by adding mixing structures to the screw.
mixing_issue_detail: However, choosing the wrong mixing structure can lead to burning, contamination, and product damage. Furthermore, when changing screw design, the balance between the feed zone (feed zone), compression zone (compression zone, taper zone) and metering zone (uniform melting zone, metering zone), as well as volume compression ratio (VCR) and effective length (L/D) are also important factors. While integrating mixing structures into the nozzle is also an effective method, we believe that mixing in the nozzle is unnecessary if the screw can perform mixing and melting theoretically. This is because we believe that unnecessary mixing can cause burning if mixing and melting can be performed in a fast cycle. At Watanabe Seisakusho, we are committed to designing that allows mixing and melting even when cycles are shortened.
mixing_issue_example: For example, when molding PP with 2% masterbatch, using single screws, single-flight screws often leads to color unevenness. Therefore, mixing components like Dulmage, Maddock or pin-type screws are often integrated into screws. While any mixing structure can improve color unevenness and melting phenomena, if the selection reason is not clearly determined, it can lead to other molding defects such as burning and contamination. Increasing the effective length (L/D) of the screw is also a good idea, but this has limitations when using existing molding or extrusion machines.
mixing_issue_solution: Therefore, Watanabe Manufacturing has analyzed each mixing structure to improve mixing and melting processes, while considering volume compression ratios as a design less likely to cause burning or contamination defects. We have proposed using two-stage mixing for mixing sections and have solved many mixing and non-melting problems.
mixing_issue_conclusion: Below is an introduction to steel material selection and basic concepts of each part when designing and manufacturing Watanabe Seisakusho's original designs to improve mixing and melting processes.
steel_selection_text: When considering improvements to mixing and melting processes, steel material selection must be considered before design. Stable molding cannot be expected if resin is not melted without hindering its flow. Regardless of this problem, selecting steel materials that allow resin to slip easily (high slip type) is a fundamental factor in plastic molding, and is a very important factor.
screw_design_title: 2. Key points in screw design to improve kneading and melting
mixing_setting_text: Considering burning/contamination defects, high cycle time and output volume, it is best not to use mixing structures, but this is a necessary factor to prevent color unevenness and melting. Watanabe Manufacturing considers burning/contamination, product degradation, cycle time and, in the case of extruders, output volume and believes that two-stage mixing is optimal. Dulmage-Madock type does not improve mixing ability; it only retains resin, leading to color unevenness and melting; it does not transport resin while being discharged. When using Dulmage-Madock type, burning/contamination defects increase. Since double-flight has a structure with flights between single flights, it is designed to enhance mixing while transporting, resulting in fewer product defects due to resin retention compared to Dulmage-Madock type.
volume_compression_ratio_text1: Traditional screw design emphasized compression ratio. However, compression ratio is only for reference when considering all screws of the same shape. However, since the length and design of each zone (metering area, compression area and feed area) actually differ, determining compression ratio only by the height difference between metering area and feed area is insufficient. Therefore, Watanabe Manufacturing considers volume compression ratio as the resin volume per lead and designs screws accordingly. High volume compression ratio can solve problems like color unevenness and melting phenomena, but if too high, the possibility of resin retention is very high. Similar to the Dalmage-Madock method in mixing ratio selection, these problems are ultimately solved by retaining resin, but burning and contamination defects will increase. Furthermore, if the volume compression ratio is too low, resin pressure will be too low, which also causes resin retention and makes resin more prone to burning. In the case of extruders, this also leads to low output.
volume_compression_ratio_text2: Volume compression ratio must be set considering screw diameter and L/D.
high_mixing_screw_text: Watanabe Manufacturing's high mixing screws consider the balance of feed zone (feed zone), compression zone (compression zone, taper resin zone) and metering zone (uniform melting zone, metering zone) and set appropriate volume compression ratios, while proposing designs that improve mixing ability with double flights.

component_notes: Points to note when selecting components
component_desc:
These three components perform three important functions. Since resin transported from the screw body must be delivered to the nozzle smoothly, the accuracy of the contact surface between the ring and seat, as well as the clearance between the inner diameter of the ring and the outer diameter of the screw tip, significantly affects contamination due to burning. As you know, wear on the outer diameter of the ring significantly affects mold accuracy.
Although considered a replaceable part, this is an important component that supports screw cylinder performance and is a key factor in achieving stable production in fully automated systems. Contact performance between nozzle and mold ultimately requires no resin leakage during injection. Wear at the tip and wear at the tip hole can cause various adverse effects. Resin accumulation on the inner diameter of the nozzle leads to contamination due to burning, so nozzles made from materials with good characteristics are necessary.
screw_design_title_1: Screw design to minimize burning and contamination (reduce defect rates and improve productivity)
screw_design_desc: Screw design that reduces rejection rates due to foreign objects and improves productivity
defect_mechanism: The mechanism of molding defects can be clarified by analyzing the chemical characteristics of resins.
defect_reduction: By using this knowledge to design screws, defect rates can be significantly reduced.
jp_defect_rate: In Japan, contamination due to burning from hydrolysis and thermal decomposition accounts for up to 70% of plastic molding defects. We believe that reducing defect rates is the biggest challenge facing molding manufacturers. In other words, reducing defect rates will lead to improved productivity and increased profits. Watanabe Manufacturing has completely redesigned existing screw types, creating a new screw design expected to reduce defect rates and improve productivity, and has proposed this to many customers.
plastic_tech_progress: Advances in plastic manufacturing technology have led to their widespread use in critical safety components, such as automotive parts and aircraft engines. This leads to increased diversity of available resin types and we believe screw design must keep up. Watanabe Manufacturing has collaborated with chemical manufacturers for about 15 years. Based on the enormous amount of resin data provided by these manufacturers, we have designed and manufactured various screws that solve molding problems based on scientific evidence, taking into account the characteristics of many different resins. By designing and manufacturing various design screws, we have understood the importance of completely melting resins. However, without understanding resin characteristics, it is impossible to design a screw that maintains complete resin melting. Although each resin has different characteristics, contamination problems due to burning can be solved by properly melting resins.
watanabe_design_basis: Watanabe Seisakusho's screw design is based on knowledge of resin characteristics, and even small details like steel material selection, volume ratios and screw root radius are carefully considered. The following introduces steel material selection and basic concepts of each part when designing and manufacturing Watanabe Seisakusho's original designs.
steel_selection_desc: To avoid hindering resin flow, selecting steel with good slip properties with resin (high slip type) is extremely important. Steel with high hardness after heat treatment and excellent mirror surface with high slip characteristics should be selected. Also, reinforcement effects from coating treatment are only considered temporary, and after the coating is removed, this effect will disappear, leading to increased defective products. Also, when considering re-coating costs, selecting steel suitable for resin characteristics when manufacturing new screws will be more cost-effective.
feeding_zone_desc: To avoid hindering resin flow, selecting steel with good slip properties with resin (high slip type) is extremely important. Steel with high hardness after heat treatment and excellent mirror surface with high slip characteristics should be selected. Also, reinforcement effects from coating treatment are only considered temporary, and after the coating is removed, this effect will disappear, leading to increased defective products. Also, when considering re-coating costs, selecting steel suitable for resin characteristics when manufacturing new screws will be more cost-effective.
compression_zone_title: 2. Compression Zone Design (compression zone, taper resin zone)
compression_zone_desc: It is important to completely melt the resin that has been compressed to a certain melting degree in the supply section in the taper section of the compression section. Not completely melting resin in the compression section can lead to stagnation, insufficient mixing and gas and moisture flowing forward. Therefore, Watanabe Manufacturing minimizes clearances and designs screws so that only molten resin or resin just before melting flows forward. Furthermore, sudden compression in the compression section can cause resin to stagnate and burn, so gradual compression is better. This increases resin density, allowing gas and moisture to escape later and preventing them from being mixed into products. Complete melting in the compression section is the most important aspect of screw design.
metering_zone_title: 3. Metering Zone Design (uniform melting zone, metering zone)
metering_zone_desc: The purpose of the metering section is to improve product quality by uniformly melting resin that has been completely melted in the compression section. At Watanabe Seisakusho, we call this the uniform melting section, and since unnecessary mixing in this section can lead to product damage, it is necessary to design this section so that transport is smooth.
three_parts_design_desc: Even with perfect screw design, if the three components are poorly designed, these parts can cause defects. It is important to prevent resin accumulation, so design requires large clearances between check ring and seat ring for resin to be transported smoothly from the screw. Clearance between the inner diameter of the check ring and outer diameter of the screw tip also needs to be considered. If the amount of resin passing through is small, resin will get stuck, causing burning and other problems. It is also important to be careful to minimize clearance between check ring and cylinder. Accuracy of the contact surface between check ring and seat ring is also very important.

company_info_text_1: Watanabe Manufacturing Co., Ltd. Introduction of corrosion and wear resistant materials
dps_series_description: This is the strongest corrosion and wear resistant material, developed by Daido Steel, the world's No. 1 special steel manufacturer, as a screw-specific material. There are various material types, including powder alloy specifications with extremely high wear and corrosion resistance.
dps400_feature_content: High wear and corrosion resistance. *Prevents burning and contamination (unique hard surface layer provides excellent resin release properties).
dps400_purpose_content: Super engineering plastics examples: PBT + GF 30% to 40%, PA + GF 30% to 40%, POM + GF 30% to 40%, PVC, etc.
dps450r_feature_content: Powder manufacturing process and ESR processing ultra-wear and ultra-corrosion resistant provides excellent corrosion resistance and mirror finish, preventing corrosion by gases such as PPS. Also ideal for GF-reinforced resins.
dps450r_purpose_content: Super engineering plastics: Usage examples: PPS + GF 30% to 40%, PA6T + GF 30% to 40%, etc.
dps570x_feature_content: Powder manufacturing process with extremely high wear and corrosion resistance combines amazing hardness with flexibility, ensuring long life even in harsh environments with any type of resin.
dps570x_purpose_content: Super engineering plastics: Usage examples: PPS + GF 50% and above, PA + GF 50% and above, LCP (high heat resistant type), mica, plastic magnets, ceramics, PEEK, etc.
corrosion_resistant_screw_diameter: Corrosion-resistant screw diameter. Φ249 Resin used: PPS+GF30%
dps570x_intro: DPS570X is manufactured using ESR treatment (special electrode consumable melting method) and genius powder alloy for molding screws, providing amazing hardness HRC68-70 and flexibility, achieving high durability even with the harshest resins. Additionally, it has high corrosion resistance due to minimal separation in structure.
corrosion_wear_test_note: Our company's resin corrosion and wear test (single side photo)
dps570x_structure_note: 570X has a more uniform structure compared to other competitor materials. Screw tip has straight bending, excellent corrosion resistance.
reported_case_1: Report from Mr. S, sales representative at Watanabe Manufacturing Co., Ltd.
reported_case_2: We manufactured bullets, screws and barrels from an automotive parts manufacturer.
consultation_content_text: The resin used is PPS + 50% glass fiber, and the molding machine manufacturer had been using corrosion and wear resistant screws for about six months. Although we don't want to increase costs, we want to improve screw durability.
watanabe_proposal_text: We propose powder-type high-speed steel DPS570X, which can handle sulfur dioxide gas generated by PPS and is also compatible with GF50%.
result_text: Two years have passed since first use, and there have been no major problems with molding. Furthermore, wear measurements show a maximum of 0.07°F after two years of use, but no significant wear or corrosion. The customer also praised that durability increased about four times without significantly increasing costs.
coating_description: In addition to standard Hor (hard chrome plating) screw types, we offer various coatings to improve corrosion and wear resistance.
screw_selection_text: Recent rapid advances in engineering plastics have led to their application in many types of critical safety components, from automotive engine parts to aircraft engines. The rapid development of new resin types, with more demanding requirements has led to increasing use of resins as functional components. Of course, we recommend using corrosion and wear resistant materials for screws and cylinders, ensuring fully automated production time even in the shortest possible time. However, there are many types of corrosion and wear resistant materials, so we recommend selecting the right screw and cylinder materials for the type of resin being molded or extruded. Super wear resistant materials are not necessary for resins with GF around 30%. Even with high GF, resins that do not generate corrosive gases do not require high corrosion resistant materials. If you encounter difficult-to-mold resins, a simple change in screw design can significantly improve molding results. Even small changes are welcome. Please consult Watanabe Seisakusho's experts.
daido_steel_note: This is the strongest corrosion and wear resistant material, developed by Daido Steel, the world's No. 1 special steel manufacturer, as screw-specific material. Watanabe Seisakusho's unique manufacturing method has helped minimize costs!!
